page.title: 02BLURTON, TRENTHAM, BARLASTON
page.content: The area that we visited was a pleasant walk. We started at Brookhouse along Barlaston Old Road and walked towards Wedgwoods. On the way we saw many points of interest such as the sewage works. We saw rough grazing land along Barlaston Road, and farm houses, but we occasionally saw houses in groups of ten. After crossing the road leading up to Wedgwoods we came to a field which we had to cross to get to the canal. The field was used for rough grazing and we had to watch our step as there were cowpats all over the place. When we reached the canal we went under the fence and on to the towpath. We saw lots of interesting things, but found that there were mainly houses by it.
